summary_promot:
You are given an image and related metadata and context.

            Metadata:
            - Document Title: The Forest of Wolves
            - Section Title: Front Hills
            - Sub-Section Title: Yaoguai Chief Mini-Boss Fight - Bullguard

            Context:
            - Preceding Text: "# The Forest of Wolves

With both enemies dead, you should start to notice a trail of gold leading you down the main path toward a shrine in a small rocky ravine.

These Shrines are your checkpoints, and offering incense at them will allow you to rest up, refill your healing gourd, travel to other shrines, and much more (some enemies — but not all — will respawn as well). You’ll also meet the owner of the voice on the wind - the Keeper of Black Wind Mountain.

This friendly guy will be your guide and mentor for this part of the world, and will bid you to set out in search of Guanyin Temple, which burned down long ago but has since been rebuilt - but not by human hands. As the Keeper departs, he’ll bestow you with the Incense Trail Talisman, which can let you warp back to the last Shrine you rested at.

## Front Hills

He’ll give a lot more experience and Will when defeated, and you can also loot a **Purple Lingzhi** on the left. On the right you can spot green wisps that denote wandering yaoguai spirits, but trying to gather them will only cause the wisps to fly off, giving you a fraction of their Will.

Head back to the forest hill road, and this time make your way right to encounter your first mini-boss, a Yaoguai Chief.

### Yaoguai Chief Mini-Boss Fight - Bullguard

Once you carve out about half of the Bullguard’s health bar, he’ll parry your next strike and move in for the killing blow — until the Keeper intervenes. Using an immobilization spell to lock him in place, the Keeper will pass on the magic spell to the Destined One, giving you your first spell - **Immobilize**!

Immobilize allows you to bind an enemy in place for a small duration, at which point you’re able to make use of the pause to unload with attacks until the effect breaks. Stronger enemies like this Yaoguai Chief will break out a lot sooner than regular foes, and certain bosses can even resist it entirely, so be wary!"
            - Following Text: "Once the Bullguard breaks free and the Keeper vanishes, it will be up to you to finish the fight. Utilize your new Immobilize Spell to bind him when it suits you best — either to ward off an incoming attack, catch your breath so you can heal, or use the moment to hit him from the side, and launch a heavy attack to send him sprawling.

Don’t get too reckless, as the Immobilize Spell has a moderate cooldown, and uses a bit of your magic meter each time. Unlike your health or stamina, you can’t regenerate magic except by resting at a Shrine.

When the beast finally falls, you’ll likely get a ton of experience, which you can invest in more skill trees that include a new one for your spells like Immobilize. The path forward is now clear to tread, but it’s still a little ways to the next Shrine. If you’re low on health, you can always head back to the Shrine and rest, as enemies like the Bullguard won’t respawn."

            Your task:
            1. Generate a **short, clear, and informative English summary** of the image.
            2. Focus primarily on the **preceding and following text** to infer the image's **purpose, content, or narrative role**.
            3. Incorporate any relevant metadata (e.g., section or document titles) to improve coherence, **but do not assume any domain-specific knowledge** unless explicitly stated.
            4. Do **not** speculate beyond the visible content.



            Output Format:
            Preceding Text Summary:
            Provide a concise summary of the preceding text that gives context to the image.
            Image Summary:
            Provide a summary of the image, describing its purpose and content based on the context.
            Following Text Summary:
            Provide a concise summary of the following text that elaborates on the information related to the image.

Preceding Text Summary:
The preceding text introduces the player to the mechanics of Shrines, which serve as checkpoints for resting, healing, and traveling. The Keeper of Black Wind Mountain is introduced as a guide who provides the Incense Trail Talisman, enabling players to warp back to Shrines. The narrative then transitions to the Front Hills area, where the player encounters wandering yaoguai spirits and prepares for their first mini-boss fight against the Yaoguai Chief, Bullguard. The Keeper intervenes during the fight, granting the player their first spell, **Immobilize**, which temporarily binds enemies.

Image Summary:
The image depicts the mini-boss fight against Bullguard, showcasing the use of the **Immobilize Spell** in action. The glowing magical effect surrounds Bullguard, indicating that he is temporarily bound. The player character is positioned in combat stance, with visible health and magic meters at the bottom left. The environment features a forested area with a shrine-like structure in the background, reinforcing the setting described in the text.

Following Text Summary:
The following text provides strategies for defeating Bullguard after he breaks free from the Immobilize Spell. Players are advised to use the spell strategically to either avoid attacks, heal, or land heavy strikes. The spell has a cooldown and consumes magic, which can only be replenished at Shrines. Defeating Bullguard rewards significant experience points, which can be used to unlock new skills, including enhancements for spells like Immobilize. The path forward opens after the fight, but players are cautioned to return to a Shrine if low on health, as Bullguard will not respawn.
